dt: {bc}one who understands the details, technique, or principles of an art and is {d_link|competent|competent} to act as a critical judge
{bc}one who enjoys with discrimination and appreciation of subtleties

quotes.t: He was a voracious reader, a strong critic, an art {qword}connoisseur{/qword} in certain directions, a collector of books, but above all he was a man of the world by profession, and loved the contacts—perhaps the collisions—of society.

Police reporting had made me a {qword}connoisseur{/qword} of auto accidents. Some people could tell a fake Rembrandt from the real thing; I could tell a run-of-the-mill fender bender from a real accident.
It was apple juice. Ortiz watched him drink it with all the delicacy of a wine {qword}connoisseur{/qword} sampling new bordeaux.

Sean "P. Diddy" Combs, now starring in Broadway's {it}A Raisin in the Sun{/it}, takes his grooming rituals seriously. "I take a bath around 3 a.m. when I get home to wind down. I'm a bath {qword}connoisseur{/qword}," says Combs, 34. "I have bath salts, bath beads—I can make you the best bath in the world."

et: obsolete French (now {it}connaisseur{/it}), from Old French {it}connoisseor{/it}, from {it}connoistre{/it} to know, from Latin {it}cognoscere{/it} {ma}{mat|cognition|}{/ma}
shortdef: expert; especially : one who understands the details, technique, or principles of an art and is competent to act as a critical judge
one who enjoys with discrimination and appreciation of subtleties
